sen.j: どんどん焼け（どんどんやけ）とは幕末の京都市中で元治元年7月18日 (旧暦)（1864年8月19日）から7月21日 (旧暦)（8月21日）まで発生した火災（大火）のことである。
sen.e: Dondon-yake is the fire (disastrous fire) broke out in the city of Kyoto at the end of Edo period from August 19 through the 21, 1864
Dondon-yake is the fire that broke out in the city of Kyoto at the end of the Edo period from August 19 to 21, 1864
Dondon-yake is the fire that broke out in the city of Kyoto at the end of the Edo period from August 19 to 21, 1864.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを打ちました。

sen.j: 「どんどん」とは見る間にどんどん焼け広がったさまとも、禁門の変に乗じて発生したことから鉄砲の音から名付けられたとも伝えられる。
sen.e: It is said that the word 'Dondon' comes from the appearance of the quickly spreading fire or the sound of gunfire because the fire broke out in the Kinmon Incident.

sen.e: It started at the residence of Choshu Domain (currently around the Kyoto Hotel Okura) in the Kinmon Incidence.

sen.j: 火の手は現在の京都御苑の西側～南東方向の広い範囲に広がり、27,000世帯が焼失した。
sen.e: The fire spread extensively over the area which is west to south-east of the current Kyoto Gyoen and 27,000 houses were burned out..

sen.j: 京都御苑事自体は焼失を免れたが市中が荒廃しきったため、明治天皇が東京に行幸する動機の1つとなったとされる。
sen.e: Kyoto Gyoen escaped the fire but the city was completely devastated, which made a reason for the Emperor Meiji to visit Tokyo.

sen.j: 東本願寺、本能寺など多くの寺院も焼失した。
sen.e: Many temples including Higashihongan-ji Temple and Honno-ji Temple were reduced to ashes.
Many temples including Higashihongan-ji Temple and Honno-ji Temple were reduced to ashes.

sen.j: 火災は、京都経済を支えてきた町衆に大きな打撃を与えた。
sen.e: The fire gave a serious blow to machi-shu (town people) who had been supporting the economy in Kyoto.
The fire dealt a serious blow to townspeople who had been supporting the economy in Kyoto.

sen.j: 町衆主導で行われてきた祇園祭は翌年中止された。
sen.e: The Gion-matsuri Festival, which was led by machi-shu, was suspended the next year.

sen.e: It was revived the year after next but was scaled down.

sen.j: 山鉾が消失するといった事情のほか、経済的な事情も大きかったものとされる。
sen.e: Other than the reasons such as the loss of Yamahoko floats, economic consideration is said to have been the decisive factor.

sen.j: 六角獄舎に捕縛されていた囚人の多くは火災が延焼することを恐れた役人により、釈放されることなく斬首されている（詳細は六角獄舎の項を参照）。
sen.e: Most prisoners in Rokkaku prison house were beheaded, instead of being released, by prison officers for fear of spreading flames. (See the Rokkaku prison house for further details.)
